constructor.name: Manager
constructor.description: Methods for all global actions that affect groups of media objects.

properties.name: this.stage
properties.description: The dimensions that will be used

functions.name: init
functions.description: initialize and open all browser windows to use

functions.name: add
functions.description: Add a new media object

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of media object to add

parameters.name: arr
parameters.description: Array that this object is added into

constructor.name: Medium
constructor.description: Template for all DOM-based media items (video, audio, text, etc)

functions.name: setAll
functions.description: Set a property on this media element in all windows

functions.name: all
functions.description: Call a method on this media element in all windows

functions.name: size
functions.description: Resize this media element

functions.name: move
functions.description: Move this element

functions.name: kill
functions.description: Remove this element and destroy all references to it

functions.name: fade
functions.description: Set the element's opacity

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Make the element disappear, but do not remove it. A/V files will keep playing and making sound.

functions.name: show
functions.description: If the element is hidden, show it.

functions.name: load
functions.description: Load an audio file via source string.

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: name of .mp3 file in /media folder. For example, .load("piano") will load "/media/piano.mp3"

functions.name: play
functions.description: Play audio file

parameters.name: rate
parameters.description: Playback rate of audio file (0.25 - 4). DOES NOT CHANGE PITCH.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Pause audio playback

functions.name: loop
functions.description: Turn audio looping on or off

functions.name: jumpTo
functions.description: Scrub to location in audio file.

functions.name: skip
functions.description: Loop audio between two points

functions.name: unskip
functions.description: Stop skipping the audio file

functions.name: speed
functions.description: Change the audio file's playback rate (does not change pitch!)

functions.name: setAll
functions.description: Set a property on this media element in all windows

functions.name: all
functions.description: Call a method on this media element in all windows

functions.name: size
functions.description: Resize this media element

functions.name: move
functions.description: Move this element

functions.name: kill
functions.description: Remove this element and destroy all references to it

functions.name: fade
functions.description: Set the element's opacity

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Make the element disappear, but do not remove it. A/V files will keep playing and making sound.

functions.name: show
functions.description: If the element is hidden, show it.

functions.name: load
functions.description: Load a video via source string.

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: name of .mp4 file in /media folder. For example, .load("waves") will load "/media/waves.mp4"

functions.name: play
functions.description: Play video

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Pause video

functions.name: loop
functions.description: Loop video

parameters.name: on
parameters.description: true if looping, false if not looping

functions.name: jumpTo
functions.description: Scrub to specific point

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: New start time of video, in seconds

functions.name: skip
functions.description: Loop video between two points

functions.name: unskip
functions.description: Stop skipping the video

functions.name: speed
functions.description: Change the video's playback rate

functions.name: ticker
functions.description: Turn on film-strip frame visualization

functions.name: unticker
functions.description: Turn off film-strip ticker visualization

constructor.name: Presence
constructor.description: Pixilated live video feed of performer

functions.name: setAll
functions.description: Set a property on this media element in all windows

functions.name: all
functions.description: Call a method on this media element in all windows

functions.name: size
functions.description: Resize this media element

functions.name: move
functions.description: Move this element

functions.name: kill
functions.description: Remove this element and destroy all references to it

functions.name: fade
functions.description: Set the element's opacity

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Make the element disappear, but do not remove it. A/V files will keep playing and making sound.

functions.name: show
functions.description: If the element is hidden, show it.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Show all browser windows in this wall

returns.description: Should return this wall object but probably doesn't now.

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Hide all browser windows in this wall (but keep them associated with this wall)

functions.name: add
functions.description: Add a new media element to this wall

functions.name: watch
functions.description: Add a film element to the wall

functions.name: hear
functions.description: Add an audio cassette element to the wall

functions.name: write
functions.description: Add a paper (text) element to the page

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: to write or .txt filename to read

functions.name: see
functions.description: Add an image canvas to the wall

functions.name: hack
functions.description: Add an embedded webpage (iframe) to the wall

functions.name: partch
functions.description: Add a just intonation pitch lattice to the wall

functions.name: say
functions.description: Add a digital voice

functions.name: scroll
functions.description: Scroll all windows to an x/y coordinate

functions.name: kill
functions.description: Destroy this wall and return all windows to stack

functions.name: killWindow
functions.description: Destroy one window in the wall

functions.name: empty
functions.description: Remove all media elements and content from all windows in this wall

functions.name: xray
functions.description: Scroll each window according to the window's place on the screen

functions.name: scramble
functions.description: Scroll each window to a random position

functions.name: move
functions.description: Move all windows to an x/y location

functions.name: size
functions.description: Resize all windows to a specific w/h

functions.name: moveby
functions.description: Move all windows by an x/y amount

functions.name: sizeby
functions.description: Resize all windows by a w/h amount

functions.name: refresh
functions.description: Refresh all windows in this wall

functions.name: goto
functions.description: Goto a URL

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: of windows to use, or array of window numbers to use

constructor.name: Window
constructor.description: Window object managed by a Wall

functions.name:
toPolar 
    Receives cartesian coordinates and returns polar coordinates as an object with 'radius' and 'angle' properties.

toCartesian 
    Receives polar coordinates and returns cartesian coordinates as an object with 'x' and 'y' properties.

clip 
    Limits a number to within low and high values.

parameters.name: high limit
parameters.description:
```js
    nx.clip(5,0,10) // returns 5
    nx.clip(15,0,10) // returns 10
    nx.clip(-1,0,10) // returns 0
    ```

functions.name:
prune 
    Limits a float to within a certain number of decimal places

scale 
    Scales an input number to a new range of numbers

parameters.name: high2
parameters.description:
output range (high)
    ```js
    nx.scale(5,0,10,0,100) // returns 50
    nx.scale(5,0,10,1,2) // returns 1.5
    ```

functions.name:
invert 
    Equivalent to nx.scale(input,0,1,1,0). Inverts a normalized (0-1) number.

mtof 
    MIDI to frequency conversion. Returns frequency in Hz.

parameters.name: MIDI
parameters.description:
MIDI value to convert
    ```js
    nx.mtof(69) // returns 440
    ```

functions.name:
random 
    Returns a random integer between 0 and a given scale parameter.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description:
Upper limit of random range.
    ```js
    nx.random(10) // returns a random number from 0 to 9.
    nx.random(10,20) // returns a random number from 10 to 19.
    ```

functions.name:
toPolar test1
    Receives cartesian coordinates and returns polar coordinates as an object with 'radius' and 'angle' properties.

toCartesian 
    Receives polar coordinates and returns cartesian coordinates as an object with 'x' and 'y' properties.

clip 
    Limits a number to within low and high values.

prune 
    Limits a float to within a certain number of decimal places

scale 
    Scales an input number to a new range of numbers

invert 
    Equivalent to nx.scale(input,0,1,1,0). Inverts a normalized (0-1) number.

mtof 
    MIDI to frequency conversion. Returns frequency in Hz.

random 
    Returns a random integer between 0 a given scale parameter.
